intro: Oncostemum seyrigii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre lily, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bulbs are an essential part of its life cycle, allowing it to survive periods of drought. Oncostemum seyrigii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
